comment: White has proceeded with his attack very well so far. His chain of pawns paralyses Black's King side, his minor pieces threaten with dangerous manoeuvres, while Black's Rooks are powerless for the moment. But White plays in too great hurry now. He should have played Nf3 or pushed his pawn to h4. These moves would have controlled the square g5 taking it away from Black's Queen and probably also forcing Black to capture the pawn on f5. Black prepares now a spectacular combination.
reasoning: The comment does explain the mistake made by the player, suggesting that White should have played Nf3 or h4 to exert more pressure on Black's position and potentially force an advantageous exchange.
